summary: This document is an email chain from June 29, 2020, between a reporter from The Daily Beast and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The reporter is inquiring about the status of the criminal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's network one year after his arrest and death, noting that no one else has been charged. The response confirms the investigation is ongoing.

persons.name: Kate Briquelet
persons.context: Reporter from The Daily Beast who is writing a story about the one-year anniversary of Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and inquiring about the status of the ongoing criminal investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: Former U.S. Attorney who vowed the criminal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's network would continue after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the criminal investigation; the reporter notes the one-year anniversary of his arrest and his subsequent death.

persons.name: Nicholas Biase
persons.context: Appears as a sender/forwarder in the email chain from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS).

connections.description: Berman, as former U.S. Attorney, vowed to continue the criminal investigation into Epstein's network after Epstein's death.
Briquelet is a reporter seeking comment from the U.S. Attorney's Office, referencing Berman's past statement about the investigation.
Briquelet is writing a story about the one-year anniversary of Epstein's arrest and the status of the investigation into his network.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested on federal sex trafficking charges.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide while in federal custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Reporter Inquiry on Investigation Status
events.description: Reporter Kate Briquelet contacts the U.S. Attorney's Office to inquire about the status of the ongoing criminal investigation into Epstein's network, one year after his arrest.

keyFacts: As of June 29, 2020, one year after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and following his death, no one else had been charged in the criminal investigation into his network.
Former U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman had previously vowed the investigation would continue after Epstein's death.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York confirmed the investigation was still ongoing as of June 29, 2020.
The email chain shows media inquiry and official response regarding the status of a high-profile federal investigation.
